b',"rating":5,"title":"Great for the Switch, if you can find it on sale","review":"The main difference from this and a cheaper San'
b'Disk Ultra, is this card is a U3 and the Ultra is U1. The U3 allows for faster installs and may save a few seconds on load times'
b'. The only reason I choose this card at the time was that it was on sale for only $3 more. I also get the awesome design along w'
b'ith 4x the storage space.For those wondering why the free space on the card read 119, it is because of the way gigabytes are cal'
b'culated.The package has 1gb equaling 1,000,000,000 bytes. Really 1gb is 1,073,741,824 bytes. That 73,741,824 bytes (73.7 megabyt'
b'es) missing per gigabyte. That really adds up.All SD card and USB stick manufacturers use this calculation method; not just Sand'
b'isk."},{"id":"R1H9CORV6UUXUX","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018","name":"ADKIc3mAnX","rating":5,'
b'"title":"This is a SanDisk Extreme! So it\xe2\x80\x99s perfect.","review":"I just purchased a Nintendo Switch at a Target, but I didn\xe2\x80\x99t'
b' realize how bad I would be needing an SD card, so I checked in stores and they had this same exact card for over $60.00. So I c'
b'hecked up Amazon and long and behold I found it for $35.00! This was an amazing deal and I have to give it to Amazon they compet'
b'e against everyone and I love it!"},{"id":"R2Q6G6E3NK7PG3","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019","nam'
b'e":"Pogo","rating":5,"title":"Grab a mushroom and grow with me.","review":"Last night, the memory card called out to me: Mario, '
b'save our princess, she\xe2\x80\x99s in another castle and we can\xe2\x80\x99t stand being without her anymore. I opened my eyes, and questioned if'
b' I really heard this or if my imagination was playing tricks on me. Since I cannot stand to hear mushrooms in distress, I immedi'
b'ately ran to the bathroom and grabbed my plunger. If it\xe2\x80\x99s good enough for Mario, it\xe2\x80\x99s good enough for me.Then I turned on my'
b' switch, and beat the hell out of bowser in smash bros.Cliff notes: this memory card, while pricier than others, is really cool '
b'and a bit nostalgic. But it works!"},{"id":"R39M0SA02EGRYZ","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019","n'
b'ame":"Nicholas Peiffer","rating":3,"title":"Storage Capacity Lies. Not 64 GB, actually 59.4 GB.","review":"Package arrived on ti'
b'me, and putting the Micro SD card into my Nintendo Switch was easy with no setup other than a update.My huge issue with this pro'
b'duct is that the packaging indicates 64 GB of storage but when I looked at my storage on the Switch it showed 59.4 GB of storage'
b' available on the Micro SD card. I have no idea what could possibly take up 4.6 GB of storage. I have none of my Nintendo files '
b'saved to the card and it indicates nothing is stored on it but clearly shows less storage than advertised.In the case that it us'
b"es that 4.6 GB for other necessary purposes then SanDisk should advertise the Micro SD card's storage capacity correctly at 59.4"
b' or lie less and at most say 60 GB of storage.Aside from being lied to about storage space the product works, and cost was reall'
b'y affordable.I would not recommend this Micro SD card unless you don\'t care about nearly 5 GB not being available."},{"id":"RW96'
b'E2AT7G3DM","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019","name":"Blaze_Piffington","rating":5,"title":"Why p'
b'ay more for namebrand when you have a more frugal and equally functionable choice?","review":"After I heard that there were some'
b' products that caused the switch to malfunction or even burn out the SD port, I took tedious care in selecting the best product '
b"for what I needed. This SD card came in clutch, it's got a Nintendo switch logo, is fully endorsed, and was a lot cheaper than n"
b'amebrand. I knew I could not go wrong in till this day, my switch is functioning like a dream. If you already made an investment'
b' in a switch, go the extra mile and purchase the extra memory for it, you\'re going to need it."},{"id":"R3TRJPKYZB7RSG","review_'
b'data":"Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019","name":"Zach ","rating":5,"title":"It\xe2\x80\x99s about as good as this could'

b'downloaded warframe and it\xe2\x80\x99s taking all of your space like me it was confusing at first where to put this tiny SD card (smalle'
b'r than a penny) but I\xe2\x80\x99ll help you guys out if you don\xe2\x80\x99t know already the stand on the back of your switch hides the slot for'
b' the card so flip your stand up and slide it in like the picture on your switch shows you and make sure it clicks in just like h'
b'ow you would put a game inNote: you paid for 128 GB of storage but your switch still has to configure it to make it compatible s'
b'o that\xe2\x80\x99ll take some storage this happens to every kind of storage unit on almost any device you use so your really buying 120-'
b'119 of storage at least that\xe2\x80\x99s what mine is left with"},{"id":"RK617YRBTWOBF","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on '

b'2HH","review_data":"Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019","name":"Daxmo!","rating":5,"title":"128GB minus 10GB","revie'
b'w":"Great for $25 ! Exactly what one needs to have more space on a single device!! However you do not get 128GB as it\xe2\x80\x99s advert'
b'ised. You get about 118GB total . (I took the pic after downloading a few games and demos) I\xe2\x80\x99m sure the other 10GB goes toward'
b's space needed for the device to recognize the SD cardor for it to configure to the switch (I\xe2\x80\x99ve got no idea just guessing ) b'
b'ut I\xe2\x80\x99d much prefer it to advertise the 118GB of actual space that you get . I\xe2\x80\x99m also not sure why it saves things to the SD '
b'card when there is available space on the Switch. I suppose it\xe2\x80\x99s so that the Switch doesn\xe2\x80\x99t get bloated then start to run sl'
b'ower or some other valid reason but it just means that if you ever remove the SD you might loose the games or at the very least '
b'have to re-download them to the device. You can get past this by removing the SD before makingcertain downloads and get more con'
b'trol of what gets saved to the device VS the SD card , but I\xe2\x80\x99m not that anal about it. The Switch does tell you where your dow'
b'nloads are saved via a blue hi-lighted section (See pictures ). Still give 5 stars because I\xe2\x80\x99m not THAT mad . Just thought I\xe2\x80'
b'\x99d share for those who are more literal with things and don\xe2\x80\x99t like to be misled."}]}'
